skill.name: ml-pipeline-workflow
skill.description: Build end-to-end MLOps pipelines from data preparation through model training, validation, and production deployment. Use when creating ML pipelines, implementing MLOps practices, or automating model training and deployment workflows.
skill.summary: Build end-to-end MLOps pipelines from data preparation through model training, validation, and produ...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and guidance with no executable code or scripts. No data access, network calls, or tool misuse patterns are present.

content.value_statement: Many teams struggle to connect data, training, validation, and deployment into one reliable flow. This skill guides you through a complete ML pipeline workflow with clear stages and practices.
actual_capabilities: Outline pipeline stages from ingestion to deployment
Recommend DAG orchestration patterns and dependencies
Describe data validation and feature engineering steps
Define training workflows with experiment tracking
Explain validation metrics and regression checks
Suggest deployment strategies such as canary and blue green
limitations: Does not execute pipelines or run code
Does not connect to cloud services or registries
Does not generate full infrastructure configurations
Requires user to provide data sources and requirements

use_cases.title: Plan data preparation flow
use_cases.description: Map data ingestion, validation, and feature engineering steps for a new ML pipeline.

use_cases.title: Design training and validation
use_cases.description: Structure training jobs, metrics, and approval gates before deployment.

use_cases.title: Prepare deployment strategy
use_cases.description: Choose rollout patterns, monitoring needs, and rollback criteria for models.

prompt_templates.title: Start a simple pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic ML pipeline plan from ingestion to deployment for a batch dataset. Include stages, inputs, and outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Add validation gates
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend the pipeline with data validation and model evaluation gates. List metrics and pass fail criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Design an Airflow DAG
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose an Airflow DAG structure for the pipeline, including dependencies and retry policies.

prompt_templates.title: Plan multi-model rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a rollout plan with canary testing, A/B validation, and rollback triggers for multiple models.

output_examples.input: Draft an end to end pipeline for a churn model with validation and deployment.
output: Stages: ingest, validate, feature engineering, train, evaluate, deploy
Validation: baseline comparison, drift checks, and performance thresholds
Deployment: canary release with rollback on regression
Monitoring: data drift and latency alerts

best_practices: Define clear stage boundaries and inputs
Track data and model versions consistently
Design rollback and monitoring before launch

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance that works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not run pipelines or generate full infrastructure configs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Airflow or Kubeflow?
faq.answer: It explains how to structure workflows for tools like Airflow and Kubeflow.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it provides text guidance only and does not access user data.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot pipeline failures?
faq.answer: Follow the staged debugging steps and validate inputs at each boundary.

faq.question: How does it compare to a deployment skill?
faq.answer: This skill covers the full pipeline, while deployment skills focus on serving and rollout.
